longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to prohibit corrupt conduct and illegal conduct at elections; to regulate electoral advertising; to impose requirements with respect to the receipt of donations and the expenditure of money at or in connection with elections; and to provide for related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires— (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 77)

def.name: Advantage

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any valuable consideration, gift or loan; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any office, employment or contract; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the full or partial payment, release, discharge or liquidation of an obligation; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the exercise of or forbearance from exercising a right or power; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the performance of or forbearance from performing a duty; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: any favour, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: giving protection from a liability incurred or anticipated; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: giving protection from proceedings or possible proceedings of a disciplinary, civil or criminal nature; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any other service (other than voluntary service or the provision of entertainment),

def.name: AppropriateAuthority
def.leadIn: appropriate authority (有關主管當局) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an election to elect the Chief Executive, the Chief Electoral Officer; and (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 77)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an election to elect a member or members of the Legislative Council, the Election Committee or a District Council, the Chief Electoral Officer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an election to elect members of the Heung Yee Kuk or to elect the Chairman or Vice-Chairman or a member of the Executive Committee of a Rural Committee, the returning officer for the election or, if the returning officer for the election has not been appointed, the Director of Home Affairs; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of an election to elect a Rural Representative, the Director of Home Affairs; (Amended 2 of 2003 s. 68; 5 of 2014 s. 67)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a person who stands nominated as a candidate at an election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: also means a person who, at any time before the close of nominations for an election, has publicly declared an intention to stand as a candidate at the election; (Amended 11 of 2012 s. 79; 14 of 2021 s. 369)

subsection.def: Chief Electoral Officer (總選舉事務主任) means the person holding office as such under section 9 of the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541);
Chief Executive (行政長官) means the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a Legislative Council election, a geographical constituency, a functional constituency or the Election Committee constituency, as defined in section 3(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542); or (Amended 25 of 2003 s. 54; 14 of 2021 s. 369)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an Election Committee subsector election, the relevant Election Committee subsector; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a District Council election, a District Committees constituency or a District Council geographical constituency, as defined by section 2 of the District Councils Ordinance (Cap. 547); (Amended 19 of 2023 s. 177)

subsection.def: Court means the Court of First Instance;
duress (脅迫手段) includes causing financial loss to a person by duress;
election (選舉) means an election to which this Ordinance applies;

def.name: ElectionAdvertisement
def.leadIn: election advertisement (選舉廣告), in relation to an election, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a publicly exhibited notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice delivered by hand or electronic transmission; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a public announcement made by radio or television or by video or cinematographic film; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other form of publication,

def.continued: published for the purpose of promoting or prejudicing the election of a candidate or candidates at the election;

subsection.def: election agent (選舉代理人) means a person who is appointed in writing by a candidate at an election to be an election agent for the candidate at the election;

Election Committee subsector (選舉委員會界別分組) means a subsector represented on the Election Committee as provided by section 2(4) of the Schedule to the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569); (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 77)

def.name: ElectionDonation
def.leadIn: election donation (選舉捐贈), in relation to a candidate or candidates at an election, means any of the following donations—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any goods given to or in respect of the candidate or candidates for the purpose of promoting the election of the candidate or candidates or of prejudicing the election of another candidate or other candidates, and includes any goods given incidental to the provision of voluntary service;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any service provided to or in respect of the candidate or candidates for the purpose of promoting the election of the candidate or candidates or of prejudicing the election of another candidate or other candidates, but does not include voluntary service;

subsection.def: election expense agent (選舉開支代理人), in relation to a candidate, means a person authorized by the candidate in accordance with section 23; (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 369)

def.name: ElectionExpenses
def.leadIn: election expenses (選舉開支), in relation to a candidate at an election, means expenses incurred or to be incurred, before, during or after the election period, by or on behalf of the candidate for the purpose of— (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 369)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: prejudicing the election of another candidate,

def.continued: and includes the value of election donations consisting of goods and services used for that purpose; (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 369)

subsection.def: election period (選舉期間), in relation to an election, means the period beginning with the nomination day for the election and ending with the polling day for the election (or the last polling day if there is more than one polling day);
election petition (選舉呈請) means an election petition lodged under an electoral law for the purpose of questioning an election held under that law;
election return (選舉申報書) means the return required to be lodged by a candidate in accordance with section 37;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect the Chief Executive, means a member of the Election Committee; and (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 77)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect a Member of the Legislative Council, means an elector as defined by section 3(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542), and in relation to a corporate elector, includes the authorized representative of the elector; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect a member of the Election Committee, means a voter as defined by section 11(1) of the Schedule to the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569) or the authorized representative of a corporate voter; and (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 77)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect a member of a District Council, means an elector as defined by section 2 of the District Councils Ordinance (Cap. 547); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect members of the Heung Yee Kuk, means a person who, in accordance with the Heung Yee Kuk Ordinance (Cap. 1097), is entitled to vote at the election; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect the Chairman or Vice-Chairman or a member of the Executive Committee of a Rural Committee, means a member of the general assembly of the Rural Committee; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect a Rural Representative for a Rural Area, means an elector, as defined by section 2(1) of the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576), for the Rural Area; (Replaced 5 of 2014 s. 67)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the District Councils Ordinance (Cap. 547); or

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569); or (Added 21 of 2001 s. 77)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Heung Yee Kuk Ordinance (Cap. 1097); or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576); (Replaced 2 of 2003 s. 68. Amended 5 of 2014 s. 67)

def.name: ElectoralOfficer
def.leadIn: electoral officer (選舉事務主任) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a returning officer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an assistant returning officer; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Electoral Registration Officer; or

paragraph.name: e

subsection.def: Electoral Registration Officer (選舉登記主任) means the person holding office as such under section 75 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) or section 44 of the Schedule to the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569) or section 51 of the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576), and includes any person appointed to act in the Officer’s place when the Officer is absent from duty or the office is vacant; (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 77; 2 of 2003 s. 68; 5 of 2014 s. 67)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes any form of violence or restraint; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in particular, includes—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: inflicting harm on a person (whether physical or mental); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: causing damage to, or destruction of, a person’s property;

subsection.def: Legislative Council (立法會) means the Legislative Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region;
organization (組織) includes a company, association, society or other body of persons;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect the Chief Executive, means the person appointed to be the Returning Officer under section 41 of the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569); and (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 77)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an election for a Legislative Council constituency, means a Returning Officer appointed for the constituency under section 78 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an election for an Election Committee subsector, means a Returning Officer appointed for the subsector under section 47 of the Schedule to the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569); and (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 77)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to an election for a constituency of a District Council, means a Returning Officer appointed for the constituency under section 75 of the District Councils Ordinance (Cap. 547); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect members of the Heung Yee Kuk, means the person appointed under section 7 of the Heung Yee Kuk Ordinance (Cap. 1097) to be the Returning Officer for the election; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect the Chairman or Vice-Chairman or a member of the Executive Committee of a Rural Committee, means the District Officer in the Home Affairs Department for the district for which the Rural Committee is established; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in relation to an election to elect a Rural Representative for a Rural Area, means a person appointed to be a Returning Officer for the Rural Area under section 54 of the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576), (Replaced 5 of 2014 s. 67)

paragraph.name: i
ii
paragraph.content: if the Returning Officer referred to in paragraph (e) or (g) has not been appointed, means the Director of Home Affairs; (Amended 2 of 2003 s. 68)

subsection.def: Rural Area (鄉郊地區) has the same meaning as in section 2(1) of the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576); (Added 5 of 2014 s. 67)
Rural Committee (鄉事委員會) has the same meaning as in section 3(3) of the Heung Yee Kuk Ordinance (Cap. 1097);
valuable consideration (有值代價) means money or anything worth money;

value (價值) means, in relation to goods or a service that is donated, the price that could reasonably be expected to be paid for the goods or service if supplied by a willing supplier to a willing buyer on the open market, with both parties acting at arms length;

def.name: VoluntaryService
def.leadIn: voluntary service (義務服務) means any service provided free of charge to or in respect of a candidate or candidates at an election by a natural person, voluntarily and personally, in the person’s own time for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: promoting the election of the candidate or candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prejudicing the election of another candidate or other candidates.

subsection.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to the withdrawal of the nomination of a person as a candidate includes, in the case of a candidate at an election to elect the Chief Executive or to elect the members of the Election Committee, a reference to the withdrawal of his candidature. (Added 21 of 2001 s. 77)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a document published by a candidate during an election period that gives details of the work done by the candidate in the capacity of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Election Committee; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 369)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Legislative Council;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a member of a District Council;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a member of the Heung Yee Kuk;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Chairman or Vice-Chairman or a member of the Executive Committee of a Rural Committee; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a Rural Representative, (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 67)

subsection.continued: is an election advertisement. (Added 11 of 2012 s. 25)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Objects of this Ordinance
section.leadIn: The objects of this Ordinance are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to ensure that, as far as practicable, elections to elect the Chief Executive and persons to membership of the Legislative Council, District Councils and certain other public bodies and to be Rural Representatives are conducted fairly, openly and honestly and are free from corrupt conduct and illegal conduct; and (Amended 2 of 2003 s. 68; 5 of 2014 s. 68)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to regulate electoral advertising so as to ensure, as far as practicable, the fairness and honesty of electoral advertising; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to ensure that candidates properly account for the expenditure of money at elections and the soliciting and receipt of election donations and that they do not exceed the prescribed levels of expenditure.

section.name: s4
section.heading: What elections do this Ordinance apply to

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), this Ordinance applies to the following kinds of elections— (Amended 11 of 2012 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an election to elect the Chief Executive;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a general election to elect the Members of the Legislative Council;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a by-election to fill a vacancy in the membership of the Legislative Council;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a subsector ordinary election to elect members of the Election Committee; (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 78)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: a by-election to fill a vacancy in the membership of the Election Committee; (Added 21 of 2001 s. 78)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an ordinary election to elect members of a District Council; (Amended 19 of 2023 s. 178)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a by-election to fill a vacancy in the membership of a District Council;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an election to elect members of the Heung Yee Kuk;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an election to elect a person as the Chairman or Vice-Chairman or a member of the Executive Committee of a Rural Committee;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a rural ordinary election to elect a Rural Representative for a Rural Area; (Replaced 5 of 2014 s. 69)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a rural by-election to elect a Rural Representative for a Rural Area. (Replaced 5 of 2014 s. 69)

subsection.leadIn: Part 5 only applies to the following kinds of elections—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an election to elect members of the Heung Yee Kuk; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an election to elect a person as the Chairman or Vice-Chairman or a member of the Executive Committee of a Rural Committee. (Added 11 of 2012 s. 26)

section.name: s5
section.heading: What conduct does this Ordinance apply to
section.content: This Ordinance applies to all conduct concerning an election, whether the conduct is engaged in within Hong Kong or elsewhere.

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Effect of inclement weather warning on date and period

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: gale warning (烈風警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);

inclement weather warning day (惡劣天氣警告日) means a working day on which a gale warning or a rainstorm warning is in force at any time during the ordinary business hours of the office of the appropriate returning officer or the appropriate authority, as may be appropriate;
rainstorm warning (暴雨警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);
working day (工作日) means any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday other than a general holiday.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an act is required by section 34(3) or (4) or 37A(6)(a) to be done not later than or within a specified number of days after— (Amended 15 of 2016 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an event; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a date on which an event occurs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the last day of those days falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the act may, despite that section, be done on the next working day, which is not an inclement weather warning day, following that last day.

subsection.content: If the date on which the period under section 34(7), 37(1A), (1B), (1D), (1F), (1H), (1J), (1L) or (1N) or 41(6) ends falls on an inclement weather warning day, the period is extended to end on the next working day, which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the date, and that section has effect accordingly. (Amended 15 of 2016 s. 3)

section.name: s6
section.heading: What penalties can be imposed for corrupt conduct at elections

subsection.leadIn: A person who engages in corrupt conduct at an election commits an offence and is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if tried summarily, liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if tried on indictment, liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years.

subsection.content: A person may be convicted of an offence of having engaged in corrupt conduct at an election if the person is found to have engaged in the conduct before, during or after the election period.

subsection.leadIn: A court that convicts a person of having engaged in corrupt conduct must order the person to pay to the court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount or value of any valuable consideration received by the person or the person’s agents in connection with the conduct; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such part of the amount or value as that court specifies in the order.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to bribe candidates or prospective candidates

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person corruptly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: offers an advantage to another person as an inducement for the other person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stand, or not to stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the other person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, to withdraw the nomination; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the other person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, not to use the other person’s best endeavours to promote the election of the other person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: offers an advantage to another person as a reward—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for having stood, or not stood, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the other person was nominated as a candidate at the election, for having withdrawn the nomination; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the other person was or has been nominated as a candidate at the election, for not having used the other person’s best endeavours to promote the election of the other person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: offers an advantage to another person as an inducement for the other person to get, or try to get, a third person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stand, or not to stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the third person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, to withdraw the nomination; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the third person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, not to use the third person’s best endeavours to promote the election of the third person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: offers an advantage to another person as a reward for having got, or having tried to get, a third person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stand, or not to stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the third person was nominated as a candidate at the election, to withdraw the nomination; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the third person was or has been nominated as a candidate at the election, not to use the third person’s best endeavours to promote the election of the third person; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: solicits or accepts an advantage as an inducement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stand, or not to stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, to withdraw the nomination; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, not to use the person’s best endeavours to promote the election of the person; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: solicits or accepts an advantage as a reward—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for having stood, or not stood, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the person was nominated as a candidate at the election, for having withdrawn the nomination; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the person was or has been nominated as a candidate at the election, for not having used the person’s best endeavours to promote the election of the person; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: solicits or accepts an advantage as an inducement to get, or try to get, another person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stand, or not to stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the other person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, to withdraw the nomination; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the other person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, not to use the other person’s best endeavours to promote the election of the other person; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: solicits or accepts an advantage as a reward for having got, or having tried to get, another person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stand, or not to stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the other person was nominated as a candidate at the election, to withdraw the nomination; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the other person was or has been nominated as a candidate at the election, not to use the other person’s best endeavours to promote the election of the other person.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person offers an advantage if the person confers, undertakes to confer or shows a willingness to confer, an advantage on another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person solicits an advantage if the person asks for, or shows a willingness to receive, an advantage, either for the person’s own benefit or for the benefit of another person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person accepts an advantage if the person receives or obtains an advantage, or agrees to receive or obtain an advantage, either for the person’s own benefit or for the benefit of another person.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a person is taken to have offered an advantage even though the offer was made by another person, but only if the other person was acting with the person’s authority. That authority may be conferred expressly or by implication.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to use or threaten to use force or duress against candidates or prospective candidates

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: uses force or duress, or threatens to use force or duress, against another person to induce the other person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stand, or not to stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the other person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, to withdraw the nomination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: uses force or duress, or threatens to use force or duress, against another person to induce the other person to get a third person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stand, or not to stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the third person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, to withdraw the nomination; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: uses force or duress, or threatens to use force or duress, against another person because the other person or a third person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: stood, or did not stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the other person or the third person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, withdrew the nomination.

subsection.content: A person is taken to have engaged in corrupt conduct of a kind referred to in subsection (1) even though the conduct was engaged in by another person, but only if the other person was acting with the person’s authority. That authority may be conferred expressly or by implication.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to engage in certain deceptive behaviour in relation to candidates and prospective candidates

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by a deception, induces another person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stand, or not to stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the other person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, to withdraw the nomination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by a deception, induces another person to get a third person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stand, or not to stand, as a candidate at the election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the third person has been nominated as a candidate at the election, to withdraw the nomination.

subsection.content: A person is taken to have engaged in corrupt conduct of a kind referred to in subsection (1) even though the conduct was engaged in by another person, but only if the other person was acting with the person’s authority. That authority may be conferred expressly or by implication.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to deface or destroy nomination papers
section.content: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person, with intent to prevent or obstruct another person from standing for election, defaces or destroys a completed or partly completed nomination paper.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to bribe electors and others at elections

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person as an inducement to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person as a reward for having voted at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person as an inducement to get, or try to get, a third person to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person as a reward for having got, or having tried to get, a third person to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: solicits or accepts an advantage as an inducement to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: solicits or accepts an advantage as a reward for having voted at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: solicits or accepts an advantage as an inducement to get, or try to get, another person to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: solicits or accepts an advantage as a reward for having got, or having tried to get, another person to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates.

subsection.leadIn: A person also engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person as an inducement not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person as a reward for not voting at the election, or for not voting at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person as an inducement to get, or try to get, a third person not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person as a reward for having got, or having tried to get, a third person not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: solicits or accepts an advantage as an inducement not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: solicits or accepts an advantage as a reward for not voting at the election, or for not voting at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: solicits or accepts an advantage as an inducement to get, or try to get, another person not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: solicits or accepts an advantage as a reward for having got, or having tried to get, another person not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person offers an advantage if the person confers, undertakes to confer or shows a willingness to confer, an advantage on another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person solicits an advantage if the person asks for, or shows a willingness to receive, an advantage, either for the person’s own benefit or for the benefit of another person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person accepts an advantage if the person receives or obtains an advantage, or agrees to receive or obtain an advantage, either for the person’s own benefit or for the benefit of another person.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a person is taken to have offered an advantage even though the offer was made by another person, but only if the other person was acting with the person’s authority. That authority may be conferred expressly or by implication.

A candidate or other person does not engage in corrupt conduct in contravention of this section only because the candidate or person has offered or solicited an offer to enter into a voting arrangement.

For the purposes of subsection (5), a voting arrangement is an arrangement under which persons agree to vote for, or get others to vote for, a candidate or candidates in return for other persons agreeing to vote for, or get others to vote for, another candidate or other candidates.
Subsection (5) applies even when the offers relate to different elections.
In a prosecution for an offence against this section, the onus of proving a reasonable excuse lies on the defendant.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to provide others with refreshments and entertainment at election

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person provides, or meets all or part of the cost of providing, food, drink or entertainment for another person for the purpose of inducing the other person or a third person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates.

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person provides, or meets all or part of the cost of providing, food, drink or entertainment for another person because the other person or a third person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has voted at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not voted at the election, or has not voted at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates.

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person solicits, accepts or takes food, drink or entertainment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as an inducement to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as an inducement not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates.

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person solicits, accepts or takes food, drink or entertainment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as a reward for having voted at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as a reward for not having voted at the election, or not having voted at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates.

subsection.content: A person does not engage in corrupt conduct of a kind referred to in subsection (1) only because the person has, at an election meeting, served non-alcoholic drinks of any kind. An election meeting is any meeting held to promote or prejudice the election of a particular candidate or particular candidates.

A person is taken to have engaged in corrupt conduct of a kind referred to in subsections (1) to (4) even though the conduct was engaged in by another person, but only if the other person was acting with the person’s authority. That authority may be conferred expressly or by implication.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to use or threaten to use force or duress against electors

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: uses force or duress, or threatens to use force or duress, against another person to induce the other person to vote at the election, or to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: uses force or duress, or threatens to use force or duress, against another person because the other person voted at the election, or voted at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: uses force or duress, or threatens to use force or duress, against another person to induce the other person to get a third person to vote at the election, or to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates.

subsection.leadIn: A person also engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: uses force or duress, or threatens to use force or duress, against another person to induce the other person not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: uses force or duress, or threatens to use force or duress, against another person because the other person refrained from voting at the election, or refrained from voting at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: uses force or duress, or threatens to use force or duress, against another person to get the other person to induce a third person not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by abduction, prevents an elector from voting at the election.

subsection.content: A person is taken to have engaged in corrupt conduct of a kind referred to in subsection (1) or (2) even though the conduct was engaged in by another person, but only if the other person was acting with the person’s authority. That authority may be conferred expressly or by implication.

A corporate elector does not contravene this section only because it has instructed its authorized representative to cast its vote, or not to cast its vote, at an election for a particular candidate or particular candidates.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to engage in certain deceptive or obstructive behaviour in relation to electors

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person, by a deception—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: induces another person to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: induces another person not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: gets another person to induce a third person to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: gets another person to induce a third person not to vote at the election, or not to vote at the election for a particular candidate or particular candidates.

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person wilfully—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: obstructs or prevents another person from voting at the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gets another person to obstruct or prevent a third person from voting at the election. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 370)

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 6(1) for having engaged in the corrupt conduct under subsection (1A) to prove that, at the time of the alleged offence, the person had lawful authority or reasonable excuse for doing the act to which the charge relates. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 370)

A person is taken to have engaged in corrupt conduct of a kind referred to in subsection (1) or (1A) even though the conduct was engaged in by another person, but only if the other person was acting with the person’s authority. That authority may be conferred expressly or by implication.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to impersonate another at election

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person, otherwise than as expressly permitted by an electoral law—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: applies for a ballot paper in the name of another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having voted at an election, applies at the same election for a ballot paper in the person’s own name.

subsection.content: In subsection (1), the reference to another person includes a reference to a person who has died or is a fictitious person as well as to an actual living person.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Corrupt conduct with respect to voting at elections

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: votes at the election knowing that the person is not entitled to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: votes at the election after having—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: given to an electoral officer information that the person knew to be materially false or misleading; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: knowingly omitted to give material information to an electoral officer; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: recklessly given to an electoral officer information that was materially false or misleading; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: except as expressly permitted by an electoral law—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an election referred to in section 4(1)(a), votes at the election more than once in the same round of voting; (Replaced 21 of 2001 s. 79. Amended 11 of 2012 s. 27)

subparagraph.name: ia
subparagraph.content: in the case of an election referred to in section 4(1)(i) or (j), votes at the election more than once; (Added 2 of 2003 s. 68. Amended 11 of 2012 s. 27)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of an election referred to in any other paragraph of section 4(1)— (Amended 11 of 2012 s. 27)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: votes at the election more than once in the same constituency; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: votes at the election in more than one constituency. (Replaced 21 of 2001 s. 79)

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person invites or induces another person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to vote at the election knowing that the other person is not entitled to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to vote at the election knowing that the other person has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: given to an electoral officer information that was materially false or misleading; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: omitted to give material information to an electoral officer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: except as expressly permitted by an electoral law—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an election referred to in section 4(1)(i) or (j), to vote at the election more than once; (Replaced 2 of 2003 s. 68. Amended 11 of 2012 s. 27)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of an election referred to in any other paragraph of section 4(1)— (Amended 11 of 2012 s. 27)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to vote at the election more than once in the same constituency; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to vote at the election in more than one constituency. (Replaced 2 of 2003 s. 68)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a person who has applied for a ballot paper for the purpose of voting at an election is taken to have voted at the election. However, a person who has applied for, and been given, a ballot paper is not to be regarded as having voted more than once at an election only because the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has spoilt the ballot paper; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after complying with the requirements of any relevant electoral law with respect to spoilt ballot papers, has voted, using another ballot paper.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to destroy or deface ballot papers

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without lawful authority, supplies a ballot paper to another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with intent to deceive, puts into a ballot box a paper other than a ballot paper that the person is lawfully authorized to put into the box; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: with intent to deceive, removes a ballot paper from a polling station; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: without lawful authority, destroys, defaces, takes or otherwise interferes with a ballot paper in use, or that has been used, at the election; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: without lawful authority, destroys, removes, opens or otherwise interferes with a ballot box in use at the election.

subsection.content: In a prosecution for an offence against this section, the onus of proving lawful authority lies on the defendant.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to make improper use of election donations
section.leadIn: A candidate or other person who uses election donations for a purpose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: other than that of meeting, or contributing towards meeting, the election expenses of the candidate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an election donation consisting of goods or a service, other than that of promoting the election of the candidate or that of prejudicing the election of another candidate or other candidates,

section.continued: engages in corrupt conduct at an election.

section.name: s19
section.heading: How candidate must dispose of certain election donations

subsection.content: A candidate or candidates must, on receiving an election donation of more than $1,000 or, in the case of an election donation consisting of goods or a service, of more than $1,000 in value, issue to the donor a receipt for the donation. The receipt must specify the name and address of the donor as supplied by the donor.

subsection.leadIn: If an election donation of more than $1,000 or, in the case of an election donation consisting of goods, of more than $1,000 in value, is given to or for a candidate or candidates and the candidate or candidates do not know the name and address of the donor, the candidate or candidates must ensure that the donation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is not used—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the purpose of meeting, or contributing towards meeting, the election expenses of the candidate or any of the candidates; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an election donation consisting of goods, for the purpose of promoting the election of the candidate or any of the candidates or of prejudicing the election of another candidate or other candidates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is given to a charitable institution or trust of a public character chosen by the candidate or candidates.

subsection.leadIn: If an election donation of money or goods has been given to or for a candidate or candidates and the donation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: has not been used—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the purpose of meeting, or contributing towards meeting, the election expenses of the candidate or candidates; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an election donation consisting of goods, for the purpose of promoting the election of the candidate or candidates or of prejudicing the election of another candidate or other candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not used in the case referred to in subsection (2),

subsection.continued: the candidate or candidates must ensure that the donation is given to a charitable institution or trust of a public character chosen by the candidate or candidates.

subsection.content: If the aggregate of all election donations given to or for a particular candidate exceeds the maximum amount prescribed under section 45, the candidate must ensure that the excess (not including election donations of services) is given to a charitable institution or trust of a public character chosen by the candidate. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 371)

subsection.leadIn: If an election donation is received by a candidate or candidates, the candidate or each of the candidates engages in corrupt conduct at an election if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the candidate or candidates fail to comply with subsection (1) or (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the candidate or candidates fail to comply with any other requirement of this section before the time when the candidate’s or each candidate’s election return for the election is lodged in accordance with section 37.

subsection.def: In this section, charitable institution or trust of a public character (屬公共性質的慈善機構或慈善信託) means a charitable institution or trust of a public character that is exempt from tax under section 88 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112). (Amended 12 of 2004 s. 28)

section.name: s20
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to lodge false or misleading election return
section.content: A candidate engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the candidate, in an election return lodged under section 37 or a copy of an election return lodged under section 37A, makes a statement that the candidate knows or ought to know is materially false or misleading whether or not the statement is the subject of a correction effected under section 37A.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Corrupt conduct to withdraw election petition or election appeal for a bribe

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person, having lodged an election petition or an election appeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withdraws the petition or appeal in return for an advantage solicited by the person or offered by another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: solicits or accepts an advantage as an inducement to withdraw the petition or appeal.

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to a person who has lodged an election petition or an election appeal as an inducement to withdraw the petition or appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person to get the other person to induce or try to induce a person who has lodged an election petition or an election appeal to withdraw the petition or appeal.

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person solicits or accepts an advantage as a reward for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having withdrawn an election petition or an election appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having induced another person to withdraw such a petition or appeal.

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in corrupt conduct at an election if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person as a reward for having withdrawn or agreed to withdraw an election petition or an election appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: offers an advantage to another person as a reward for having got a person who has lodged an election petition or an election appeal to withdraw the petition or appeal.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person solicits an advantage if the person asks for, or shows a willingness to receive, an advantage, either for the person’s own benefit or for the benefit of another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person accepts an advantage if the person receives or obtains an advantage, or agrees to receive or obtain an advantage, either for the person’s own benefit or for the benefit of another person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person offers an advantage if the person confers, undertakes to confer or shows a willingness to confer, an advantage on another person.

section.name: s22
section.heading: What penalties can be imposed for illegal conduct at elections

subsection.leadIn: Any person who engages in illegal conduct at an election commits an offence and is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if tried summarily, liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if tried on indictment, liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.content: A person may be convicted of an offence of having engaged in illegal conduct at an election if the person is found to have engaged in the conduct before, during or after the election period.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Illegal conduct for persons other than candidates and election expense agents to incur election expenses

subsection.content: A person, other than a candidate or a candidate’s election expense agent, engages in illegal conduct at an election if the person incurs election expenses at or in connection with the election.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: However, subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person publishes an election advertisement on the Internet; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the only election expenses incurred by the person for the purpose of publishing the advertisement are either or both of the following charges—

subparagraph.content: electricity charges;
charges necessary for accessing the Internet. (Added 1 of 2019 s. 30)

subsection.content: A candidate engages in illegal conduct at an election if election expenses incurred by the candidate or by the candidate’s election expense agent are not included in the candidate’s election return.
An election expense agent engages in illegal conduct at an election if the agent incurs election expenses that exceed the amount specified in the agent’s authorization.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person is an election expense agent of a candidate if— (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 372)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the maximum amount of election expenses that the person is authorized to incur is specified in the authorization; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a copy of the authorization has been served on the appropriate returning officer.

subsection.content: An authorization referred to in subsection (5) remains in force until the end of the relevant election period unless it is revoked earlier. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 372)

section.name: s24
section.heading: Illegal conduct for candidate to incur election expenses exceeding prescribed amount

subsection.content: A candidate engages in illegal conduct at an election if the aggregate amount of election expenses incurred at or in connection with the election by or on behalf of the candidate exceeds the maximum amount of election expenses prescribed for a candidate by regulations in force under section 45.

subsection.leadIn: In a prosecution alleging illegal conduct under this section by a candidate, it is a defence for the candidate to prove that the election expenses were incurred—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without negligence by the candidate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: either without the candidate’s consent or in excess of an amount specified in an authorization under section 23.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, the value of an election donation consisting of goods or services is taken to be an amount of election expense incurred by or on behalf of a particular candidate or particular candidates if the goods or services are used for the purpose of promoting the election of the candidate or candidates or of prejudicing the election of another candidate or other candidates.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Illegal conduct to publish false statement that a person is or is not a candidate

subsection.content: A person engages in illegal conduct at an election if the person publishes a statement, knowing it to be false, that the person or another person is a candidate at the election.
A candidate engages in illegal conduct at an election if the candidate publishes a statement, knowing it to be false, that the candidate is no longer a candidate at the election.

A person engages in illegal conduct at an election if the person publishes a statement, knowing it to be false, that another person who has been nominated as a candidate is no longer a candidate at the election.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Illegal conduct to publish false or misleading statements about a candidate

subsection.content: A person engages in illegal conduct at an election if the person publishes a materially false or misleading statement of fact about a particular candidate or particular candidates for the purpose of promoting or prejudicing the election of the candidate or candidates.

subsection.leadIn: A candidate engages in illegal conduct at an election if the candidate publishes a materially false or misleading statement of fact about the candidate or candidates with whom the candidate is associated, or about another candidate or other candidates, for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: promoting the election of the candidate or candidates with whom the candidate is associated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prejudicing the election of the other candidate or candidates.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, statements about a candidate or candidates include (but are not limited to) statements concerning the character, qualifications or previous conduct of the candidate or candidates.

In a prosecution for an offence of having engaged in illegal conduct under subsection (1) or (2), it is a defence to prove that the defendant believed on reasonable grounds that the statement was true at the time when it was made.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Illegal conduct to publish election advertisement that includes false claim of support

subsection.leadIn: A candidate engages in illegal conduct at an election if the candidate publishes, or authorizes the publication of, an election advertisement that includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name or logo of or associated with a person or an organization; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a name or logo that is substantially similar to the name or logo of or associated with a person or an organization; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a pictorial representation of a person,

subsection.continued: in such a way as to imply, or to be likely to cause electors to believe, that the candidate or candidates with whom the candidate is associated have the support of the person or organization unless the condition specified in subsection (1A)(a) or (b) is met and the requirement specified in subsection (1B) is complied with. (Amended 11 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the publication of the election advertisement, the person or organization consented in writing to the inclusion of the name, logo or pictorial representation in the advertisement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the candidate has neither requested or directed nor authorized any person to request or direct the inclusion of the name, logo or pictorial representation in the advertisement. (Added 11 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the election advertisement meets the condition specified in subsection (1A)(a) or (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any content of the advertisement is provided by the person or organization,

subsection.continued: the candidate must not modify, or authorize any person to modify, the name, logo or pictorial representation or the content unless before the modification, the person or organization consented in writing to the name, logo, pictorial representation or content as modified. (Added 11 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in illegal conduct at an election if the person publishes, or authorizes the publication of, an election advertisement that includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name or logo of or associated with another person or an organization; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a name or logo that is substantially similar to the name or logo of or associated with another person or an organization; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a pictorial representation of another person,

subsection.continued: in such a way as to imply, or to be likely to cause electors to believe, that a particular candidate or particular candidates have the support of the other person or organization unless the condition specified in subsection (2A)(a) or (b) is met and the requirement specified in subsection (2B) is complied with. (Amended 11 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the publication of the election advertisement, the other person or organization consented in writing to the inclusion of the name, logo or pictorial representation in the advertisement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has neither requested or directed nor authorized any other person to request or direct the inclusion of the name, logo or pictorial representation in the advertisement. (Added 11 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the election advertisement meets the condition specified in subsection (2A)(a) or (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any content of the advertisement is provided by the other person or organization,

subsection.continued: the person must not modify, or authorize any person to modify, the name, logo or pictorial representation or the content unless before the modification, the other person or organization consented in writing to the name, logo, pictorial representation or content as modified. (Added 11 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1A), (1B), (2A) and (2B), the consent of an organization is taken to have been obtained if— (Amended 11 of 2012 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the consent was given by an officer of the organization; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the candidate or person who publishes, or authorizes the publication of, the election advertisement believed on reasonable grounds that the officer had authority to give the consent.

subsection.content: A candidate or other person engages in illegal conduct for having published or authorized the publication of an election advertisement of a kind referred to in subsection (1) or (2) despite the fact that the advertisement contains a statement to the effect that the inclusion in the advertisement of a name or logo of or associated with a person or an organization, or a pictorial representation of a person, does not imply support by the person or organization for a candidate or candidates.

A person engages in illegal conduct at an election if the person purports to give consent in writing to the inclusion in an election advertisement of the name or logo of or associated with an organization without having been approved by the governing body of the organization or by a resolution of the members of the organization passed at a general meeting.

A person engages in illegal conduct at an election if the person, for the purpose of promoting or prejudicing the election of a candidate or candidates, gives information to the candidate or candidates that the person knows or ought to know is materially false or misleading.

subsection.def: In this section, support (支持), in relation to a candidate, includes support for the policies or activities of the candidate.

section.name: s27A
section.heading: Illegal conduct to incite another person not to vote, or to cast invalid vote, by activity in public during election period

subsection.leadIn: A person engages in illegal conduct at an election if the person carries out any activity in public that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: incites another person not to vote at the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: incites another person voting at the election to deal with a ballot paper issued to the person in any way that would render the ballot paper invalid at the election under any electoral law.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) applies only to an activity in public carried out during the election period of the election concerned.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether any activity in public incites another person as described in subsection (1), regard may be had to all circumstances of the case, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the contents of the activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the intended audience of the activity; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which the activity is carried out.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 22(1) for having engaged in the illegal conduct under subsection (1) to prove that, at the time of the alleged offence, the person had lawful authority or reasonable excuse for doing the act to which the charge relates.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: activity in public (公開活動) includes any of the following activities, whether or not the person carrying out the activity is in a public place while carrying out the activity—(a)any form of communication to the public, including speaking, writing, printing, displaying notices, broadcasting, screening and playing of tapes or other recorded material;(b)any conduct (not being a form of communication referred to in paragraph (a)) observable by the public, including actions and gestures and the wearing or display of clothing, signs, flags, emblems and insignia;(c)the distribution or dissemination of any matter to the public.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Court empowered to restrain person from repeating certain illegal conduct

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, on the hearing of an application under this section, grant an injunction restraining a person who is found to have engaged in illegal conduct at an election in contravention of section 25, 26, 27 or 27A— (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 375)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from continuing or repeating the conduct; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: from engaging in any other conduct of a similar nature.

subsection.content: An injunction under this section may be granted on such terms as the Court considers appropriate.
The Court may, in addition to granting an injunction, make an order requiring a person to do a specified act.

The Court may grant an interim injunction pending the determination of an application under this section. Such an injunction may be granted merely on the basis of rebuttable evidence of the illegal conduct alleged to have been engaged in.

subsection.leadIn: An application for an injunction under this section can be made by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an election referred to in section 4(1)(a), (i) or (j), a candidate at the election; (Amended 2 of 2003 s. 68; 11 of 2012 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: an election referred to in any other paragraph of section 4(1), a candidate at the election— (Amended 11 of 2012 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the same constituency; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in the case of an election relating to the Heung Yee Kuk or a Rural Committee, for the same body; or (Replaced 21 of 2001 s. 80)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the election agent of such a candidate; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who is registered as an elector for the constituency, Rural Area or body concerned; or (Amended 2 of 2003 s. 68; 5 of 2014 s. 70)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the election is one at which corporate electors are eligible to vote, a member of a body that is registered as a corporate elector for the constituency or body concerned; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the election is to elect a person as a Member of the Legislative Council to represent a functional constituency, a body mentioned in section 25(4) or (5) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542). (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 375)

subsection.leadIn: An application for an injunction under this section can also be made by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who alleges that the name or logo of or associated with the person, or a pictorial representation of the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an organization that alleges that the name or logo of or associated with the organization,

subsection.continued: has been included in an election advertisement in contravention of section 27.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Court Proceedings Relating to Corrupt and Illegal Conduct

section.name: s29
section.heading: Interpretation: Part 4

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, a candidate is to be regarded as having personally engaged in corrupt or illegal conduct if the conduct was engaged in with the knowledge and consent of the candidate.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a candidate is not to be regarded as having engaged in corrupt or illegal conduct by an agent if the candidate satisfies the Court that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the candidate was not aware of the conduct; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the candidate, if aware of the conduct, did not consent to or connive at it.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Court to declare candidate to be elected in certain circumstances despite corrupt or illegal conduct by agents

subsection.leadIn: If, on the hearing of an election petition alleging that a candidate was not duly elected because the candidate engaged in corrupt or illegal conduct at the election, the Court finds that the conduct was engaged in by an agent of the candidate, the Court must nevertheless determine the candidate to have been duly elected if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the candidate did not personally engage in the conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conduct did not materially affect the result of the election; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the candidate took reasonable steps to ensure that no corrupt or illegal conduct was engaged in at the election in relation to the candidate; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: neither the candidate nor any of the candidate’s agents engaged in any other corrupt or illegal conduct at the election.

subsection.content: If the Court makes a determination under subsection (1) in respect of particular conduct, it must also order that the candidate concerned is not to be subject to any disqualification under the relevant electoral law in relation to that conduct.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Court may make orders relieving candidates from consequences of certain illegal conduct

subsection.content: A candidate, candidate’s agent or any other person who has done or omitted to do an act that, but for this section, would be illegal conduct at an election may apply to the Court for an order under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of an application under subsection (1), the Court may make an order relieving the applicant from penalties and disqualifications that are imposed by, or could be imposed under, an electoral law for any act or omission of the applicant that, but for this section, would be illegal conduct at an election, but only if the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the act or omission was due to inadvertence, an accidental miscalculation or any reasonable cause and was not due to bad faith; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the Court requires notice of the application to be given in Hong Kong, the notice has been given; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: believes it to be just that the applicant should not be subjected to one or more of those penalties and disqualifications.

subsection.content: If an application is made under subsection (1), no prosecution against the applicant for having done or omitted to do an act that, but for this section, would be illegal conduct at an election may be instituted or carried on until the application is disposed of by the Court.

An applicant is not liable to be convicted of an offence of having engaged in illegal conduct at an election if the act or omission of the applicant that, but for this section, would be illegal conduct at the election is the subject of an order made under subsection (2).

section.name: s32
section.heading: Witness who is party to corrupt or illegal conduct not to be regarded as accomplice
section.content: In a prosecution against a person for having engaged in corrupt or illegal conduct at an election, a witness is not to be regarded as an accomplice only because the witness was a party to the conduct.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Interpretation: Part 5
section.def: printed election advertisement (印刷選舉廣告) means an election advertisement printed on any material; (Added 11 of 2012 s. 29)
printer (印刷人), in relation to a printed article, includes any person who reproduces the article by any means; (Amended 11 of 2012 s. 29)
registered local newspaper (註冊本地報刊) means a newspaper registered under section 7 of the Registration of Local Newspapers Ordinance (Cap. 268).

section.name: s34
section.heading: Offence to publish election advertisements that do not meet certain requirements

subsection.leadIn: A person must not publish a printed election advertisement that fails to show, in the English or Chinese language—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the printer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which it was printed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of copies printed.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to an election advertisement that is printed in a registered local newspaper.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) is not contravened in relation to the publication of a printed election advertisement if, not later than 7 days after the advertisement is published, the publisher, or a person authorized by the publisher, has lodged with the appropriate returning officer a statutory declaration that states—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the printer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which it was printed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of copies printed.

subsection.content: A person must, not later than 7 days after publishing a printed election advertisement, furnish 2 copies of the advertisement to the appropriate returning officer.
If a printed election advertisement is published in a registered local newspaper, the duty to comply with subsection (4) is on the person who seeks to place the advertisement in the newspaper.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (4) commits an offence and is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if tried summarily, liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if tried on indictment, liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.content: A returning officer must keep each copy of statutory declaration or an election advertisement lodged with the officer under this section for 6 months after the date on which the result of the relevant election is published and may then destroy it or dispose of it in some other manner.
Subject to subsection (5), any person who authorizes the publication of an election advertisement is taken to have published the advertisement for the purposes of this section.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Court may grant relief in certain circumstances if election advertisements do not meet requirements

subsection.content: A person who publishes a printed election advertisement without complying with section 34(1) or (4) may apply to the Court for an order under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of an application made under subsection (1), the Court may make an order allowing the publication which would, but for this section, constitute an offence under section 34, be excepted from the relevant requirements under that section and relieving the applicant from the penalties imposed by that section, but only if the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: where the Court requires notice of the application to be given in Hong Kong, the notice has been given; and

paragraph.name: b
