paragraph.content: believes it to be just that the applicant should not be subject to those penalties.

subsection.content: If an application is made under subsection (1), no prosecution against the applicant for not having complied with section 34(1) or (4) may be instituted or carried on until the application is disposed of by the Court.
An applicant is not liable to be convicted of an offence under section 34 if the non-compliance by the applicant with section 34(1) or (4) is the subject of an order made under subsection (2).

section.name: s37
section.heading: Candidate to lodge election return with appropriate authority

subsection.leadIn: Each candidate at an election must lodge with the appropriate authority an election return setting out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the candidate’s election expenses at the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all election donations received by or on behalf of the candidate in connection with the election.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For an election to elect the Chief Executive, the candidate must ensure that the return is lodged before the expiry of the period of 60 days after the date on which— (Amended 11 of 2019 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the result of the election is published in the Gazette; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings for the election are declared to have been terminated. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: For an election to membership of the Legislative Council, the candidate must ensure that the return is lodged before the expiry of the period of 60 days after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the election is held for 2 or more constituencies—the date on which the election becomes settled in relation to all of the constituencies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the election is held for only 1 constituency—the date on which the election becomes settled in relation to the constituency. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1B), an election is settled in relation to a constituency on the date on which any of the following events occurs in relation to the constituency, or, if more than one of the following events occurs in relation to the constituency, on the date on which the last of those events occurs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the result of the election is notified in the Gazette;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the election is declared to have failed. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.leadIn: For an election to membership of the Election Committee, the candidate must ensure that the return is lodged before the expiry of the period of 30 days after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, according to a notice published under section 4 of the Electoral Affairs Commission (Electoral Procedure) (Election Committee) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. I), the election is one of the subsector elections that are to be held on the same date—the date on which the subsector elections become settled or, if the subsector elections become settled on different dates, the last of those dates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the date on which the election becomes settled. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1D), an election is settled on the date on which any of the following events occurs in relation to the election—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the result of the election is notified in the Gazette;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a declaration that no candidate was validly nominated is made. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1F
subsection.leadIn: For an election to membership of any District Council, the candidate must ensure that the return is lodged before the expiry of the period of 60 days after— (Amended 19 of 2023 s. 179)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the election is held for 2 or more constituencies in relation to 1 or more District Councils—the date on which the election becomes settled in relation to all of the constituencies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the election is held for only 1 constituency—the date on which the election becomes settled in relation to the constituency. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1G
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1F), an election is settled in relation to a constituency on the date on which any of the following events occurs in relation to the constituency—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the result of the election is notified in the Gazette;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the election is declared to have failed. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1H
subsection.leadIn: For an election relating to the Heung Yee Kuk, the candidate must ensure that the return is lodged before the expiry of the period of 30 days after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the election is held for 2 or more vacancies—the date on which the election becomes settled in relation to all of the vacancies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the election is held for only 1 vacancy—the date on which the election becomes settled in relation to the vacancy. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1I
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1H), an election is settled in relation to a vacancy on the date on which any of the following events occurs in relation to the vacancy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the result of the election is announced by the returning officer for the election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the election is declared to be invalid. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1J
subsection.leadIn: For an election relating to a Rural Committee, the candidate must ensure that the return is lodged before the expiry of the period of 30 days after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the election is held for 2 or more offices—the date on which the election becomes settled in relation to all of the offices; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the election is held for only 1 office—the date on which the election becomes settled in relation to the office. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1K
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1J), an election is settled in relation to an office on the date on which any of the following events occurs in relation to the office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the result of the election is announced by the returning officer for the election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings for the election are declared to have been terminated;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the election is declared to have failed. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1L
subsection.leadIn: For a Rural Representative election for a Rural Area, the candidate must ensure that the return is lodged before the expiry of the period of 30 days after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, according to a notice under section 20(3)(b) of the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576) or section 6 of the Electoral Procedure (Rural Representative Election) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. L), the election is one of the Rural Representative elections in relation to the same Rural Committee that are to be held on the same date—the date on which the Rural Representative elections become settled or, if the Rural Representative elections become settled on different dates, the last of those dates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the date on which the election becomes settled. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1M
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1L), an election is settled on the date on which any of the following events occurs in relation to the election, or, if more than one of the following events occurs in relation to the election, on the date on which the last of those events occurs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the result of the election is notified in the Gazette;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings for the election are declared to have been terminated;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the election is declared to have failed. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1N
subsection.content: Despite subsections (1A), (1B), (1D), (1F), (1H), (1J) and (1L), the return may be lodged within any extended period allowed by the Court under section 40. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: The candidate must ensure that the return—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is accompanied—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of each election expense of $500 or more, by an invoice and a receipt giving particulars of the expenditure; and (Amended 11 of 2019 s. 14)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of each election donation of more than $1,000 or, in the case of an election donation consisting of goods or a service, of more than $1,000 in value, by a copy of the receipt issued to the donor giving particulars of the donor and the donation; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where an election donation or part of an election donation that was received by or on behalf of the candidate in connection with the election was not used for that purpose was disposed of in accordance with section 19, by a copy of the receipt given by the recipient of the donation or part; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: where an election donation or part of an election donation that was received by or on behalf of the candidate in connection with the election was not used for that purpose was not disposed of in accordance with section 19(3), by an explanation setting out the reason why it was not disposed of in accordance with that section; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: by a declaration in a form provided or specified by the appropriate authority verifying the contents of the return.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2), an invoice and a receipt for an election expense may be included in the same document.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Rural Representative election (鄉郊代表選舉) means a rural ordinary election as defined by section 2(1) of the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576) or a rural by-election as defined by that section;
subsector election (界別分組選舉) has the meaning given by section 1(1) of the Schedule to the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569). (Added 15 of 2016 s. 5. Amended 14 of 2021 s. 376)

section.name: s37A
section.heading: Relief for minor errors etc. in election return

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any error or false statement in an election return lodged by a candidate the nature of which is a failure to set out in the election return any election expense of the candidate at the election concerned or any election donation received by or on behalf of the candidate in connection with the election—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that is required under section 37 to be set out in the election return; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that does not exceed the limit prescribed in the Schedule for the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any error or false statement in an election return lodged by a candidate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the nature of which is incorrectness in the amount of any election expense of the candidate at the election concerned or any election donation received by or on behalf of the candidate in connection with the election; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the correction of which requires an adjustment not exceeding the limit prescribed in the Schedule for the election in that amount.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are 2 or more errors or false statements in an election return; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the aggregate value of those errors or false statements exceeds the limit prescribed in the Schedule for the election concerned,

subsection.continued: this section does not apply to the errors or false statements.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the value of an error or false statement is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the nature of the error or false statement is a failure to set out an election expense or election donation, the amount of the election expense or election donation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the nature of the error or false statement is incorrectness in the amount of an election expense or election donation, the extent, in monetary terms, of the adjustment required to correct the error or false statement.

subsection.content: Despite section 37, if this section applies to any error or false statement in an election return lodged by a candidate, the candidate may lodge, subject to subsections (5) and (6), with the appropriate authority a copy of the election return which is marked with the necessary revision to have the error or false statement corrected.

A candidate may not lodge a copy of an election return in relation to an election under subsection (4) if the aggregate amount of election expenses incurred at or in connection with the election by or on behalf of the candidate exceeds the maximum amount of election expenses prescribed for a candidate by regulations in force under section 45.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of an election return lodged under subsection (4) by a candidate is of no effect unless—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: if the nature of the error or false statement is a failure to set out an election expense or election donation in the election return, it is accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: (in the case of an election expense) an invoice and a receipt; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (in the case of an election donation) a copy of a receipt and, if applicable, an explanation,

paragraph.continued: required under section 37(2)(b) had the election expense or election donation been set out in the election return; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is accompanied by a declaration by the candidate in a form provided or specified by the appropriate authority verifying the contents of the copy of the election return.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (6), an invoice and a receipt for an election expense may be included in the same document.

subsection.leadIn: On the receipt under subsection (4) by an appropriate authority of a copy of an election return which is marked with any revision described in that subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the revision is deemed, except for the purposes of section 20, to have been made in the election return before the election return was lodged; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an invoice, a receipt, a copy of a receipt or an explanation (if any) accompanying the copy is deemed, except for the purposes of section 20, to have accompanied the election return when the election return was lodged.

subsection.content: A candidate may only lodge one copy of an election return under subsection (4) in respect of an election. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 377)
A copy of an election return may not be withdrawn or amended after it has been lodged under subsection (4).
The Chief Executive in Council may by order amend the Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to an error or false statement in an election return includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an error or false statement in any document accompanying the election return; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a failure to send any document required by section 37(2)(b) in relation to the election return.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Offence to fail to lodge election return

subsection.leadIn: A candidate who fails to lodge an election return as required by section 37 commits an offence and is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if tried summarily, liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if tried on indictment, liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.content: If a candidate has made an application under section 40, no prosecution against the candidate for failing to have lodged an election return as required by section 37 may be instituted or carried on until the application is disposed of by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: A candidate is not liable to be convicted of an offence under subsection (1) for failing to have lodged an election return as required by section 37 if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the further period specified in the order has not yet expired.

subsection.content: A candidate who is convicted of an offence under subsection (1) is subject to the same disqualifications as a person convicted of having engaged in illegal conduct.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Offence to act in office or participate in affairs of body if no election return is lodged

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if, having been elected to an office or membership of a body at an election to which this Ordinance applies, the person acts in the office or participates in the affairs of the body as a member without having complied with section 37.

A person found guilty of an offence under this section is liable on summary conviction to a fine of $5,000 for each day on which the person acts in the office or participates in the affairs of the body as a member without having complied with section 37.

subsection.leadIn: A person is not liable to be convicted of an offence under this section for acting in the office or participating in the affairs of the body as a member without having complied with section 37 if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the non-compliance is the subject of an order made under section 40; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the further period specified in the order has not yet expired.

subsection.leadIn: A person who acts in the office or participates in the affairs of the body as a member without having complied with section 37, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s application for an order under section 40 is refused; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has not complied with section 37 within the further period specified in the order made under section 40,

subsection.continued: may be convicted of an offence under this section and is liable on conviction to the daily fine referred to in subsection (2) counting from the day on which the person began to act in the office or participate in the affairs of the body as a member without having complied with section 37.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Court may grant relief to candidate in certain circumstances

subsection.content: A candidate who is unable or has failed to lodge an election return as required by section 37 before the end of the permitted period can apply to the Court for an order allowing the candidate to lodge with the appropriate authority an election return within such further period as the Court specifies.

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of an application made under subsection (1), the Court may make the order sought, but only if it is satisfied that the inability or failure to lodge an election return as required by section 37 was attributable to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant’s illness or absence from Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the death, illness, absence from Hong Kong or misconduct of an agent or employee of the applicant; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: inadvertence or an accidental miscalculation by the applicant or any other person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any reasonable cause,

subsection.continued: and was not due to the applicant’s bad faith.

subsection.content: A candidate can also apply to the Court for an order enabling the candidate to correct any error or false statement in an election return or in any document accompanying the return.

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of an application made under subsection (3), the Court may make the order sought, but only if it is satisfied that the error or false statement was due to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: misconduct of an agent or employee of the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inadvertence or an accidental miscalculation by the applicant or any other person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any reasonable cause,

subsection.continued: and was not due to the applicant’s bad faith.

subsection.content: A candidate who has not complied with section 37(2)(b)(i), (ii) or (iii) can also apply to the Court for an order excepting the candidate from the requirement to send an invoice or a receipt, or a copy of a receipt, as required by that section.

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of an application made under subsection (5), the Court may make the order sought, but only if it is satisfied that the non-compliance was due to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: misconduct of an agent or employee of the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: any reasonable cause,

subsection.continued: and was not due to the applicant’s bad faith.

subsection.content: In making an order under this section, the Court may impose such conditions as it considers to be appropriate for carrying into effect the objects of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with a condition imposed in an order made under this section commits an offence and is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if tried summarily, liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if tried on indictment, liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.content: A candidate who is convicted of an offence under subsection (8) is subject to the same disqualifications as a person convicted of having engaged in illegal conduct.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Appropriate authority to keep election returns

subsection.leadIn: The appropriate authority must keep at the office of the authority— (Amended 18 of 2011 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all election returns lodged with the authority under section 37; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all copies of election returns lodged with the authority under section 37A.

subsection.content: The appropriate authority must, during the relevant period, ensure that copies of the documents kept under subsection (1) are made available for inspection by any person who, during the authority’s business hours, asks to inspect any of the documents.

If a person asks for a copy of a document or part of a document kept under subsection (1), the appropriate authority must provide the person with such a copy, subject to payment of a copying fee not exceeding an amount calculated in accordance with a rate fixed in accordance with subsection (4).

The appropriate authority is required, by notice published in the Gazette, to fix a rate for the purposes of subsection (3). The fixing of the rate is subject to the approval of the Financial Secretary. Such a notice is not subsidiary legislation for the purposes of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

After the end of the relevant period, the appropriate authority may arrange for the documents kept by the authority under subsection (1) to be destroyed, but if, during that period, a candidate who has lodged any of the documents with the authority asks for it to be returned to the candidate, the authority must comply with the request.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the relevant period, in relation to a document lodged with the appropriate authority, is the period beginning with the time when the document is lodged with the authority and ending with— (Amended 15 of 2016 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an election referred to in section 37(1D), (1H), (1J) or (1L)—the 30th day before the first anniversary of the date of the deadline for lodging the relevant election return under that section (disregarding any order made by the Court under section 40); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an election referred to in section 37(1A), (1B) or (1F)—the 60th day before the first anniversary of the date of the deadline for lodging the relevant election return under that section (disregarding any order made by the Court under section 40). (Amended 15 of 2016 s. 6; 11 of 2019 s. 15; 19 of 2023 s. 180)

section.name: s42
section.heading: Officers liable to be found guilty of offences committed by corporation

subsection.leadIn: If a corporation is found guilty of having engaged in corrupt or illegal conduct, each person who was an officer of the corporation when the conduct was engaged in is also liable to be found guilty of having engaged in the conduct unless the person proves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the conduct was engaged in without the person’s knowledge; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the conduct was engaged in with that person’s knowledge, that the person exercised reasonable diligence to prevent the conduct from being engaged in.

subsection.def: In this section, officer (高級人員), in relation to a corporation, means a director, executive officer or other person who is concerned in the management of the corporation.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Attempts to be treated as complete offences

subsection.content: A person who, with the relevant knowledge or intent, attempts to do an act that constitutes an offence against this Ordinance is guilty of attempting to commit the offence.

A person who is convicted of an attempt to commit an offence against this Ordinance is subject to the same penalties and disqualifications imposed by any law to which the person would have been subject on conviction of the offence attempted.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Rights of creditors not affected by contravention of this Ordinance
section.content: The fact that an election expense has been incurred in contravention of this Ordinance does not prevent a person who has supplied goods or services in relation to which the expense was incurred from exercising any rights that the person has as a creditor under the contract for the supply of the goods or services if the person was unaware of the contravention at the time when the contract was entered into.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Chief Executive in Council may make regulations

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations prescribing the maximum amount of election expenses that can be incurred by or on behalf of a candidate at an election. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 378)

A regulation under this section may prescribe different maximum amounts for different kinds of elections and for different constituencies and for different Rural Areas and for different bodies to which this Ordinance applies. (Amended 2 of 2003 s. 68; 5 of 2014 s. 72)

section.name: s46
section.heading: Repeal of Corrupt and Illegal Practices Ordinance
section.content: The Corrupt and Illegal Practices Ordinance (Cap. 288) is repealed.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Transitional provision
section.content: Any subsidiary legislation made under the Corrupt and Illegal Practices Ordinance (Cap. 288) before its repeal and in force at the commencement* of this Ordinance is, so far as it is not inconsistent with this Ordinance, to continue in force and have the like effect for all purposes as if made under this Ordinance.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Saving provision
section.content: The repeal of the Corrupt and Illegal Practices Ordinance (Cap. 288) does not affect any obligation or liability incurred, or any penalty or disqualification imposed, or any investigation or legal proceedings instituted, under that repealed Ordinance; and any such penalty or disqualification may be imposed, and any such investigation or legal proceedings may be instituted or carried on, as if this Ordinance had not been passed.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Transitional provision for Electoral Legislation (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2016
section.leadIn: If the poll of an election—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: would have been held on a date before that commencement date* if the election were contested; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: would have been held on a date before that commencement date* but for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any postponement or adjournment;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the termination of the proceedings for the election;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the failure of the election; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the invalidity of the election,

section.continued: the amendments to sections 5A, 37 and 41, and the repeal of section 36, made by the amending Ordinance do not apply to the election, and the provisions of this Ordinance in force immediately before that commencement date* continue to apply to the election as if the amending Ordinance had not been enacted.
